page.title: 09CROFTERS
page.content: The N.E. boundary of Horwich is nowadays where the Greater Manchester conurbation finally gives way to Green belt and open country.It has always been on the fringe of things. The oldest part of Horwich was probably near the Parish Church.The most significant economic activity apart from farming would be to do with textiles.Previous to the Industrial Revolution woolens were made at home from the carding,spinning,weaving to fulling and bleaching. The old word for bleacher was "crofter".The soft water from the hillside would be used.Pub names such as "Jolly Crofters" hint at this. In the 19th.century many of the larger mills,such as Wallsaches were bleachers.
